name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the 1920s about Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romance novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage rebellion and angst as experienced by Holden Caulfield.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventure of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest.

name: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

name: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: A novel about the experiences of the titular character, including her growth to adulthood and love for Mr. Rochester.

name: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill Moby Dick, the giant white sperm whale.

name: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that tells the story of five families during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that follows the hero Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

name: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a young man named Raskolnikov who plots to kill a pawnbroker.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel about a future society driven by technology and social control.

name: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Bronte
description: A novel about the intense and tragic love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel about the lives of three brothers and their father's murder.

name: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A novel about the life of Emma Bovary, who dreams of a more romantic and glamorous life.

name: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem describing Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

name: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the events of the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles.

name: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel about the growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

name: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A novel about the adventures of a nobleman who reads so many chivalric romances that he decides to become a knight-errant.

name: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel about the tragic affair between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novel about the Joad family's journey from Oklahoma to California during the Great Depression.

name: The Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel about the absurdities of war, particularly during World War II.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A novel that tells the multi-generational story of the Buendia family in the fictional town of Macondo.

author: Herman Melville
description: The quest of Ishmael and Captain Ahab to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.
